header: The Proud Assyrian Is God’s Instrument

verse: But it will not happen that way. When the Lord has completed all of his work against Mount Zion and against Jerusalem, I will bring punishment against the bloated fruit of the willful heart of the king of Assyria and against the glare in his haughty eyes.
The Light of Israel will be a fire, and his Holy One a flame, and it will burn and devour its thorns and its briers in a single day.
He will consume the splendor of its forest and of its fruitful field completely. It will be like a sick man wasting away.
The remaining trees in its forest will be so few that a child could record their number.

header: A Remnant of Israel Will Return

verse: It will come about in that day that those who remain from Israel and those from the house of Jacob who have survived will never again lean on the one who struck them, but they will truly lean on the Lord, the Holy One of Israel.
A remnant will return to the mighty God, namely, the remnant of Jacob.
Although your people, Israel, are like the sand of the sea, only a remnant will return. Complete destruction has been decreed—overwhelming, but righteous.
For the Lord, the Lord of Armies, will bring about the destruction decreed for the whole earth.
Therefore the Lord, the Lord of Armies, says, “You my people who dwell in Zion, do not be afraid of the Assyrian, though he strikes you with the rod and lifts up his club against you as Egypt did.
For in a very little while, my rage against you will be finished, and my anger will be directed to his destruction.”
The Lord of Armies will raise up a whip against him, as he did in the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb. His rod will stretch over the sea, and he will lift it up as he did against Egypt.
In that day he will remove the burden that he placed on your shoulder and the yoke he placed on your neck. The yoke will be destroyed because your neck has grown so fat.
